intro: Campanula sparsa subsp. sphaerothrix, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It features upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped flowers, typically blue to violet in color. The plant has lanceolate to ovate leaves that are often hairy and adapted to cold, rocky environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and alpine tundras. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plant collections.
